itemDescription: South African World War I flying ace

wikipedia_page.main:
Lieutenant Gerald Frank Anderson MBE, DFC was a South African born flying ace. During World War I, he was accredited with eight aerial victories.
In later life, he went into business, then served in Her Majesty's Foreign Service. He was also famed as a composer of chess problems.

response: *Gerald Frank Anderson (1898–1984), South African born flying ace
*Gerald Frank Anderson, , Second Secretary, Her Majesty's Embassy, Washington.
